ideas.name: ephemeral_workers
ideas.title: Ephemeral Worker Spawning System
ideas.description: Parallel task execution with specialized sub-agents that spawn on-demand and self-destruct
ideas.notes: Based on Dust.tt pattern, enables parallel execution

ideas.name: yaml_prompts
ideas.title: YAML-Based Prompt System (DUPLICATE - See #005)
ideas.description: DUPLICATE: This idea was merged into #005 (yaml_prompt_system) for consolidation.
ideas.notes: Merged into #005. Keep for ID continuity.

ideas.name: domain_prompts
ideas.title: Domain-Specific Prompt Templates
ideas.description: Pre-built prompt layers for common use cases (research, job apps, coding)

ideas.name: multi_provider_behavior
ideas.title: Multi-Provider Behavior Profiles
ideas.description: Switch between API providers (OpenRouter, HuggingFace, Together.ai) based on desired behavior profile (conservative, permissive, unrestricted)
ideas.notes: Critical insight: Provider choice = behavior baseline. Combine with prompt layering for fine control. Reduces prompt engineering effort significantly.

ideas.name: yaml_prompt_system
ideas.title: Convert Prompt Layers to YAML Format
ideas.description: Refactor agent/prompts.py from Python code to YAML files for non-technical editing. Enables rapid behavior experimentation and domain-specific agent creation without code changes.
benefits: Enables domain-specific prompts without code changes
ideas.implementation_notes: Create prompts/core/, prompts/domain/, prompts/specialists/ folders. Implement YAML loader in agent/prompts.py. Migrate existing Python prompts.
ideas.notes: Foundation for scalable behavior management. Pairs well with multi-provider (#004) for complete control. Merged from duplicate idea #002.

ideas.name: mcp_bridge
ideas.title: Connect to MCP Module Manager (47+ Tools)
ideas.description: Build bridge to existing MCP servers at C:\...\mcp-module-manager. Auto-discover available tools, translate MCP schemas to OpenAI function format, and register dynamically. Instant access to 47+ proven tools.
benefits: No reinventing wheels - leverage existing work
ideas.implementation_notes: Create tools/mcp/bridge.py. Implement MCP protocol client. Build schema translator (MCP â†’ OpenAI format). Add auto-registration to agent/core.py.
ideas.notes: Game-changer for capabilities. MCP servers already exist at C:\Users\k\Documents\Projects\mcp-module-manager.

ideas.name: tool_registry_autodiscovery
ideas.title: Auto-Discover Native Tools from Filesystem
ideas.description: Eliminate manual tool registration. Scan tools/native/ folder for Python files, import dynamically, extract schemas, and register automatically. New tools work immediately without touching agent/core.py.
ideas.implementation_notes: Use importlib to scan tools/native/. Require standard export format (TOOL_SCHEMA + execute_tool function). Build registry in agent/core.py initialization.
ideas.notes: Quick win. Pairs well with MCP bridge for unified tool management.

ideas.name: increase_iteration_limit
ideas.title: Raise Default MAX_ITERATIONS to 20-30
ideas.description: Current 10-iteration limit works for simple tasks but blocks complex workflows. Increase default to 20-30 for research/analysis tasks. Keep configurable via CLI flag.
ideas.implementation_notes: Change default in agent/config.py from 10 to 25. Test with complex queries. Document in CLI help.
ideas.notes: Low-hanging fruit. Can implement immediately if needed.

ideas.name: browser_automation
ideas.title: Integrate Anthropic Computer Use API
ideas.description: Enable agent to control web browsers via Claude Computer Use API. Click buttons, fill forms, navigate multi-page workflows. Unlocks job applications, web scraping, and complex automation tasks.
ideas.implementation_notes: Add BROWSER_AUTOMATION task type. Create tools/native/browser.py wrapper. Handle screenshots + coordinate clicking. Test on LinkedIn/Indeed. Requires 20-50 iterations per task.
ideas.notes: High-value but large effort. Blocks job application use case. Consider after other Phase 4 features.

ideas.name: persistent_memory
ideas.title: SQLite/JSON Memory for Cross-Session Context
ideas.description: Add persistent memory so agent remembers past interactions, user preferences, and completed tasks across sessions. Store in SQLite or JSON files. Critical for job applications (track applied positions) and personalized interactions.
ideas.implementation_notes: Create agent/memory.py with SQLite backend. Store: user_facts, task_history, preferences. Add memory retrieval to ReAct loop. Implement privacy controls.
ideas.notes: Pairs with browser automation for job tracking. Can use simple JSON initially, migrate to SQLite later.
